prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.
stories:
The anticipation is building as the Eurovision Song Contest approaches, with Malmo, Sweden hosting this year's event. 

One artist to watch is Olly Alexander, representing the UK with his song "Dizzy" in 2024. With a global audience of 200 million people, the pressure is on for his performance on the big night.

De-Graft had the chance to sit down with Olly and discuss his preparations for the competition. 

Make sure to tune in to BBC One or iPlayer on Saturday 11 May to catch all the excitement of the Eurovision Song Contest Grand Final!

As the countdown to the Eurovision Song Contest begins, all eyes are on the charming city of Malmo, Sweden, where this year's event will take place.

Among the many talented artists set to grace the stage, Olly Alexander stands out as a rising star representing the UK with his captivating song "Dizzy" in 2024. With hundreds of millions of viewers eagerly awaiting his performance, the pressure is undoubtedly high for the young artist.

During an exclusive interview with De-Graft, Olly shared insights into his rigorous preparations for the competition, revealing the dedication and hard work behind his upcoming show-stopping performance.

Don't miss the electrifying atmosphere of the Eurovision Song Contest Grand Final, airing live on BBC One or iPlayer on Saturday 11 May. Get ready to witness a night of unforgettable music, dazzling performances, and fierce competition as countries from around the world come together to celebrate the power of music.

With the world watching, the stage was set for the biggest music event of the year in the beautiful city of Malmo, Sweden. Among the lineup of incredible artists, one name shone brightly - Ava Johnson, a pop sensation from the US who was ready to take the Eurovision Song Contest by storm with her infectious hit "Starlight" in 2025.

As the anticipation built up, Ava's fans around the globe eagerly awaited her performance, knowing that she would bring something truly special to the stage. In an intimate interview with Rolling Stone, Ava opened up about the creative process behind her song and the emotions she hoped to evoke in her audience.

Now, the time had come for Ava to show the world what she was made of. With the pressure on her shoulders and the eyes of millions upon her, she stepped out onto the stage, ready to give the performance of a lifetime.

Tune in to the Eurovision Song Contest Grand Final, streaming live on all major platforms on Saturday 8 May. Get ready to be swept away by the magic of music as artists from every corner of the globe come together to celebrate the universal language that unites us all.

In the heart of Tokyo, Japan, the stage was set for the annual International Music Festival, where artists from all over the world would come together to showcase their talents. Among the diverse lineup of musicians, one name stood out - Kazuki Yamamoto, a rising star from Japan with his powerful ballad "Sakura Tears".

As the excitement built up, Kazuki's dedicated fans eagerly awaited his performance, knowing that he would deliver a show-stopping performance that would touch the hearts of all who listened. In a candid interview with Billboard, Kazuki shared the inspiration behind his song and the deep emotions he poured into every note.

Now, the moment had arrived for Kazuki to wow the audience with his raw talent and soulful voice. With the spotlight shining on him and the crowd holding their breath in anticipation, he took the stage, ready to leave his mark on the world.

Don't miss the International Music Festival Grand Finale, airing live on all major networks on Saturday 12 September. Prepare to be captivated by the power of music as artists from different cultures and backgrounds come together to share their love for the universal language of music.
